    • Constructor Detail

      • Polygon

        public Polygon(byte[] rawData)
        This constructor is used when the Polygon is being created from data that is read directly from a file.
        Parameters:
        rawData - A byte array containing all of the raw data needed to create the Polygon, starting with the bounding box, i.e. leaving out the ShapeType data.

      • Polygon

        public Polygon(int[] parts,
               double[][] points)
        This is the constructor that is used when creating a new polyline. Note that the vertices for polygon holes must be entered in a counter-clockwise order as per the ShapeFile specifications.
        Parameters:
        parts - an int array that indicates the zero-base starting byte for each part.
        points - a double[][] array containing the point data. The first dimension of the array is the total number of points in the polyline.
